snippet: California forestry regulators have issued a conditional logging permit to the Pacific Lumber Company with a warning that further violation of the state's timber rules could result in permanent loss of the license.    The agreement, negotiated bet...
lead_paragraph: California forestry regulators have issued a conditional logging permit to the Pacific Lumber Company with a warning that further violation of the state's timber rules could result in permanent loss of the license. The agreement, negotiated between Pacific Lumber and the State Department of Forestry on Tuesday, ended a weeklong crisis for the company, which faced the prospect of stiff sanctions as it sought broader authority to cut trees on its land.
abstract: California grants Pacific Lumber Co conditional logging permit with warning against further violation of state's timber rules; Pacific's parent, Maxxam Corp, negotiates deal with Federal and state officials seeking to buy redwood grove that would let Pacific cut trees on its remaining property (S)
